titleStmt.title: D. A. Brown et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG2782

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
To Hon
Beriah Maggoffin
Governr of Ky

We the undersigned Citizens of Webster County would respectfully represent to your honor that on the day of 186 -- Jessee Ashby a Justice of the peace for Webster County and for the Slaughtersville district did tender his resignation to the County Court of Webster County which was accepted We would state that at that time the said Ashby had determined to leave this county and that since that time he has concluded to remain we would respectfully ask your honor to appoint the said Jessee Ashby as one of the Mag Justices of the peace of said county and district and will ever ask &c

J. A Brooks
B D Winstead
Jno D Rice
S, H Woolfolk
G C Gaines
Stephen Timmons
John W Reynolds
L D Orr Judge County Court

Webster Co
J. P.
Dist No 3
Appd Apr 24 1862
